intro: Viguiera inegii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Viguiera inegii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
